Text.Value: She already has.
Keep walking.
A now I have the undying love of the Absolute. I pity you will  never know that feeling.
Leave me alone. Please.
I've found peace. I feel it every time I close my eyes and imagine slitting your throat.
You're a lost cause. I only pray you're more useful dead than you were alive.

EditorData.NodeContext: venom in her voice - she wants her words to hurt

Text.Value: You're lucky, you know. It's rare that Disciple Balthazar takes a personal interest in prisoners.

EditorData.NodeContext: smirking as she speaks to her prisoners - cruel

Text.Value: You know, the rest I can understand, but you're one of us.
I am doing this because of Elturel. We were driven out of our homes because we're weak.

EditorData.NodeContext: determined and authorative - trying to make her fellow tieflings see the power of the absolute

Text.Value: Or, if you're very lucky, perhaps he will split you open and sew in a new one.

EditorData.NodeContext: a venemous smile at her cruel words

Text.Value: The Absolute gave me a new name, a new life. She can do the same for you.

EditorData.NodeContext: determined and authorative - trying to make her fellow tieflings see the power of the absolute

Text.Value: Through the Absolute, we will be weak no more. You should be grateful to be part of that.

EditorData.NodeContext: determined and authorative - trying to make her fellow tieflings see the power of the absolute

Text.Value: *Sigh.* You'll see the truth soon enough, whether you like it or not.

EditorData.NodeContext: speaking to fellow tieflings, thinks them lesser than her

Text.Value: Pray I never get out of here, Warden - the Absolute won't stop me, or my blade.
Were you as strong as you claim, you wouldn't be here. Neither would your brother.

EditorData.NodeContext: rubbing salt in the wound of a prisoner, trying her best to break them mentally

Text.Value: A nice play, but everyone I loved died screaming in Avernus.
I am far gentler than Disciple Balthazar. You wish to live? Grow a spine.
Few survive Disciple Balthazar's experiments. This is your chance to submit to the Absolute - to find peace.

EditorData.NodeContext: this is, in a strange way, the warden trying to be comforting, even if it comes across cruel

Text.Value: Fuck. Off.
Nice speech, but take it elsewhere.

EditorData.NodeContext: scared but trying not to be

Text.Value: I am not one of you. Elturel proved what we knew all along - these horns and tail are a curse.

EditorData.NodeContext: determined and authorative - trying to make her fellow tieflings see the power of the absolute

Text.Value: I used to be like you - weak. Frail. But then I found the Absolute. She can help you.

EditorData.NodeContext: smirking as she speaks to her prisoners - in her own way she's trying to help, but she sees them as lesser

Text.Value: Please, don't do this. Please.

EditorData.NodeContext: pleading with a fellow tiefling to save him

Text.Value: You're from Elturel, aren't you? Why in the hells are you doing this to us?!
Maybe a part of you was always missing, but the Absolute has broken you - throughly.
You saw how they treated us in Elturel. You should be helping us!
Someone must have loved you - a mother, a father, a lover. What would they say now, if they saw you?

Synopsis: Warden has an exchange with the tieflings in Jail.
